title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 55.2 - Teacher opportunity corps program
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 55.2 - Teacher opportunity corps program

State Regulations
(a) Definitions. For purposes of the teacher
opportunity corps program: (1)

Minorities
historically underrepresented in the teaching field means residents of New York

State who are black, Hispanic, native American Indian or Alaskan
native. (2)
A student who is
economically disadvantaged means a student who meets the criteria set forth in
subdivisions (b) and (c) of section
27-1.1
of this Title, except that
paragraphs (2) and (4) of subdivision (b) of section
27-1.1
shall not apply. (3)

An approved program leading to permanent
certification in teaching means a program registered by the department and
offered in New York State which has been determined by the commissioner to
satisfy academic requirements for permanent certification in
teaching. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
55.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
